properties.name: St James's Park
properties.location:
London SW1A 2BJ
United Kingdom
properties.description: St James's Park is a historic Royal Park located in the heart of London, known for its beautiful landscapes and vibrant flowerbeds. Covering 57 acres, the park features a picturesque lake with swans, surrounded by scenic walking paths and lush greenery. Visitors can enjoy stunning views of Buckingham Palace, making it a popular spot for both tourists and locals. The park is home to various wildlife, including pelicans that were first introduced in the 17th century. With its rich history and serene atmosphere, it serves as a peaceful retreat within the bustling city.

properties.name: Buckingham Palace
properties.location:
London SW1A 1AA
UK
properties.description: Buckingham Palace, the official residence of the British monarch, is an iconic landmark in London. With over 775 rooms, including 19 state rooms, the palace serves both as a royal home and a working building where official events and ceremonies occur. The palace's stunning architecture and opulent interiors attract millions of visitors each year, who come to witness the Changing of the Guard ceremony and explore the State Rooms, which are opened to the public during the summer months. Surrounded by beautiful gardens, Buckingham Palace is a symbol of the British monarchy and rich history.

properties.name: Big Ben
properties.location:
London SW1A 0AA
UK
properties.description: Big Ben is the nickname for the Great Bell of the clock at the north end of the Palace of Westminster in London, widely recognized as a symbol of the United Kingdom. The tower, officially named the Elizabeth Tower, was completed in 1859 and stands at 316 feet (96 meters) tall. Its clock faces are 22.5 feet (6.9 meters) in diameter, making them some of the largest in the country. The site attracts millions of visitors each year who come to admire its iconic Victorian Gothic architecture and listen to its chimes that resonate across the city.

properties.name: Churchill War Rooms
properties.location:
King Charles St
London SW1A 2AQ
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Churchill War Rooms are a part of the Imperial War Museum, located in the heart of London. This historic site served as the underground nerve center for Britain's military operations during World War II. Visitors can explore the preserved rooms, including Churchill's bedroom and the Cabinet War Room, gaining insights into strategies, leadership, and life during wartime. The museum also features an exhibition dedicated to Winston Churchill, showcasing personal artifacts, speeches, and multimedia presentations. The atmosphere captures the essence of resilience and determination that characterized an entire nation during a pivotal time in history.

properties.name: Westminster Bridge
properties.location:
Westminster Bridge
London SW1A 2JH
United Kingdom
properties.description: Westminster Bridge is an iconic structure spanning the River Thames, offering stunning views of the Houses of Parliament and Big Ben. Originally opened in 1862, the bridge features a striking design with its characteristic green color, reminiscent of the House of Commons. It serves as a vital connection between the bustling areas of Westminster and Waterloo, frequented by pedestrians and tourists eager to capture the sights of central London. The bridge is often illuminated at night, making it a beautiful focal point in the cityscape.

properties.name: Somerset House
properties.location:
Strand
London WC2R 1LA
United Kingdom
properties.description: Somerset House is an elegant neoclassical building located on the Strand in central London. Originally built in the 18th century, it now serves as a multi-purpose arts venue, hosting exhibitions, events, and performances throughout the year. The courtyard is famous for its fountains and ice rink, attracting both locals and tourists. Somerset House is home to a variety of cultural institutions, including the Courtauld Institute of Art, housing an impressive collection of artworks. Its beautiful architecture and diverse programming make it a must-visit destination for those exploring London's rich artistic heritage.

properties.name: Waterloo Bridge
properties.location:
London WC2R 2PP
UK
properties.description: Waterloo Bridge, completed in 1945, is an iconic structure spanning the River Thames in London. Known for its elegant design by Sir Giles Gilbert Scott, the bridge offers panoramic views of the city, including landmarks such as the London Eye and St. Paul's Cathedral. It has played a significant role in London's history, serving as a vital transport link and a symbol of resilience during World War II. The bridge is also famous for its appearance in various films and literature, making it a cultural landmark as well as a functional piece of infrastructure.

properties.name: The Courtauld Gallery
properties.location:
Somerset House
Strand, London WC2R 0RN
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Courtauld Gallery, situated within Somerset House, showcases an impressive collection of European paintings, sculptures, and decorative arts. Its highlights include works by renowned artists such as Van Gogh, Monet, and Gainsborough. The gallery is particularly noted for its collection of Impressionist and Post-Impressionist masterpieces. Open to the public, it offers a serene environment for art lovers and visitors to explore the rich history of art through its diverse exhibitions. The gallery also facilitates educational programs and events, enriching the cultural experience for all who visit.

properties.name: Kerridge's Bar & Grill
properties.location:
Whitehall Place, Whitehall
London, SW1A 2BD
United Kingdom
properties.description: Kerridge's Bar & Grill, situated within the Corinthia Hotel London, is the first London restaurant by Michelin-starred chef Tom Kerridge. The restaurant offers a menu that reflects refined British comfort food and re-born classics, including dishes like fresh Cornish crab vol-au-vent, glazed omelette 'Lobster Thermidor', and Kerridge's fish and chips. The interior, designed by David Collins Studio, features a grand, high-ceilinged dining room furnished with leather-upholstered dining chairs and deep button-backed banquettes. A striking rotisserie bar roasts large joints of meat, fish, and root vegetables in front of diners, adding to the theatrical dining experience.

properties.name: Gordon's Wine Bar
properties.location:
47 Villiers St
London WC2N 6NE
United Kingdom
properties.description: Gordon's Wine Bar is a historic wine bar located near the River Thames, established in 1890, making it one of the oldest wine bars in London. The bar features a vast selection of wines from around the world, offering both bottled and house wines for patrons. Its intimate and atmospheric cellar offers a unique environment, adorned with wooden barrels and vintage decor. Guests can enjoy a selection of cheeses and charcuterie to accompany their drinks, making it a popular spot for wine enthusiasts and casual visitors alike.

properties.name: Spring
properties.location:
New Wing, Somerset House, Strand
London, WC2R 1LA
United Kingdom
properties.description: Spring is a contemporary British restaurant situated in the New Wing of Somerset House, a neoclassical building on the Strand in London. Led by chef Skye Gyngell, formerly head chef at the Michelin-starred Petersham Nurseries, the restaurant offers a daily-changing menu that highlights seasonal British produce. Dishes may include slow-cooked pork with sage, fennel, and blood orange, or sirloin with Jerusalem artichokes, grilled leeks, cime di rapa, and aïoli. Desserts feature options like bitter chocolate pavé with bourbon, rye, and marmalade ice cream, or St Jude cheese with truffled honey, walnuts, and carta di musica. The dining space is housed in a restored 19th-century drawing room that had been closed to the public for 150 years, providing a unique and elegant setting for guests.

properties.name: Monument to the Great Fire of London
properties.location:
Fish St Hill
London EC3R 8AH
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Monument to the Great Fire of London commemorates the Great Fire of 1666 that devastated the city. Standing at 61 meters tall, it is one of the tallest isolated stone columns in the world. The structure features a gilded sphere at the top, symbolizing the flames of the fire. Visitors can climb 311 steps to reach an observation deck that offers panoramic views of the surrounding area. Located near the original site of the fire, the monument serves as both an important historical marker and an architectural marvel.

properties.name: St Dunstan in the East Church Garden
properties.location:
St Dunstan's Hill
London EC3R 5DD
United Kingdom
properties.description: St Dunstan in the East Church Garden is a historic public garden located in the heart of London. Originally a church built in the 12th century, it was severely damaged during the Blitz in World War II. The ruins have been transformed into a serene garden, offering a peaceful retreat amid the urban landscape. Visitors can wander through lush greenery, admire beautiful flowers, and explore the remnants of the church's walls, creating a unique blend of nature and history. The garden serves as a popular spot for both locals and tourists seeking tranquility in a bustling city.

properties.name: St George-in-the-East Church
properties.location:
St George in the East Crypt West
14 Cannon St Rd, London E1 0BH
United Kingdom
properties.description: One of Nicholas Hawksmoor's London churches, St George-in-the-East was constructed in 1729 in what was then a poor area outside the City walls, near the Wapping marshland. Severely damaged by bombing during World War II, its interior was rebuilt in 1964, essentially creating two churches in one. Visitors can explore the gardens, which feature historic tombstones repurposed as walkways. The grounds also contain a derelict nature history museum. The church hosts community events throughout the week, including coffee mornings and football. It's known for being a peaceful place.

properties.name: Fatto a Mano Tower Bridge
properties.location:
Unit 3, Tower Bridge House
St Katharine's Way, London E1W 1BA
United Kingdom
properties.description: Fatto a Mano Tower Bridge is a pizzeria located along the waterfront of St Katharine Docks, just a short walk from Tower Bridge. The restaurant features a large outdoor terrace overlooking the marina, providing a relaxed atmosphere for diners. The menu offers a variety of authentic Neapolitan pizzas, including classics like Margherita and Diavola, as well as unique options such as the Popeye pizza topped with 'nduja honey. Additional offerings include sides like lasagna fritta and garlic bread, along with desserts like tiramisu and gelato. The drink selection features Italian wines, craft beers, and refreshing cocktails. The open kitchen allows guests to watch the pizzaioli in action, adding to the dining experience. Both reservations and walk-ins are welcome, accommodating parties of all sizes.

properties.name: Honest Burgers St Katharine Docks
properties.location:
1 Commodity Quay
London E1W 1AZ
UK

properties.name: King Edward Memorial Park
properties.location:
The Hwy
London E1W 3HT
United Kingdom
properties.description: King Edward Memorial Park is a public open space in Shadwell, London, situated along the northern bank of the River Thames. Opened in 1922 in memory of King Edward VII, the park spans 3.3 hectares and is the 11th largest in the London Borough of Tower Hamlets. It features a bandstand, children's play area, bowling green, all-weather football pitch, and tennis courts. The park is recognized for its biodiversity and has received the Green Flag Award. Accessible paths and public toilets cater to wheelchair users, and the Thames Path runs through the park, offering scenic riverside views.

properties.name: The Yurt Café
properties.location:
St. Katharine's Precinct
2 Butcher Row, London E14 8DS
UK
properties.description: The Yurt Café, London's first yurt café, is a unique establishment located at St. Katharine's Precinct, 2 Butcher Row, London E14 8DS, UK. Operated by The Royal Foundation of St Katharine, it offers a warm and welcoming space for people from all walks of life. The café serves a variety of breakfast, lunch, and brunch options, including vegan and vegetarian choices. It also hosts community events and provides a venue for private hire, accommodating up to 35 guests for a seated meal or 70 for a standing reception. Committed to ethical and sustainable practices, the café sources food locally and reinvests profits into community activities. The Yurt Café is a distinctive dining experience in a Mongolian-inspired yurt structure, offering a unique atmosphere in the heart of London. Its commitment to community engagement and sustainability makes it a noteworthy destination for both locals and visitors seeking a unique café experience in London. The café's dedication to providing a space for connection and creativity is evident in its diverse menu and community-focused initiatives, making it a valuable asset to the Limehouse area and beyond.

properties.name: Kirvem Restaurant & Bar
properties.location:
663 Commercial Rd
London E14 7LW
United Kingdom
properties.description: Kirvem Restaurant & Bar offers a vibrant dining experience in Limehouse, London. Known for its authentic Turkish cuisine, the menu features dishes like mixed grills, chicken wings, and king prawns. Desserts such as ice cream, tiramisu, and Turkish delight are also available. The restaurant provides a cozy atmosphere with attentive service, making it a popular choice among locals and visitors alike.

properties.name: The Grapes
properties.location:
76 Narrow St
London E14 8BP
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Grapes is a historic pub situated at 76 Narrow Street in London's Limehouse area, directly on the north bank of the Thames. Dating back to 1583, it boasts a Grade II listing on the National Heritage List for England. The pub features a traditional Victorian long bar with wooden paneling and burgundy-colored walls adorned with oil paintings. A notable feature is The Dickens Snug, where Charles Dickens is reputed to have danced on the tables. The establishment offers a heated terrace overlooking the Thames, providing scenic views of Canary Wharf and the City of London. The menu includes classic British dishes such as fish and chips, as well as a variety of small plates and main courses. The Grapes is co-owned by actor Sir Ian McKellen, director Sean Mathias, and publisher Evgeny Lebedev.

properties.name: Bread Street Kitchen & Bar
properties.location:
44 Narrow St
London E14 8DJ
UK
properties.description: Located at 44 Narrow St, London, Bread Street Kitchen & Bar is known for its steaks and roasted cod. The Limehouse restaurant offers a varied Sunday menu with roasts, including medium-rare beef. Some diners recommend the Beef Wellington, while the steak pie and sticky toffee pudding have received positive feedback. A seasonal set menu and a selection of drinks are available.

properties.name: Limehouse Basin
properties.location:
Limehouse Basin
London E14
UK
properties.description: Limehouse Basin provides access to the Regent's Canal, the River Lee Navigation, and the Thames. Situated in London, this marina and nature site is near the DLR station. Visitors can relax and sunbathe there. It is considered a safe area with access to the underground. The location is ideal for walking and cycling with routes to Canary Wharf. Since it is less touristy, it offers a peaceful retreat.

properties.name: Limehouse Town Hall
properties.location:
646 Commercial Rd
London E14 7HA
UK
properties.description: Limehouse Town Hall is a grand Victorian building, known for its impressive architecture and rich history. Constructed in the late 19th century, it served as a municipal hall for local governance and has hosted numerous events over the years. The building's elegant facade features classical design elements, making it a noteworthy landmark in the Limehouse area. Today, Limehouse Town Hall is often used for community activities, public meetings, and special events, contributing to the cultural fabric of the locality.

properties.name: Museum of the Book
properties.location:
170 Salmon Ln
London E14 7PQ
UK
properties.description: The Museum of the Book, located at 170 Salmon Lane in London, is dedicated to the history of the Bible. It houses a world-class collection of original ancient manuscript and printed Bibles, with manuscripts dating from 4000 BC to AD 1600 and written in more than 20 languages, including Hebrew, Greek, Latin, and English. The museum also features archaeological artifacts that emphasize the historical accuracy of the Bible. Visitors can view first editions of the 1611 King James Bible and explore rare bindings and biblical art. The museum is open for free admission immediately following all scheduled services and events of Church of The Book.

properties.name: Traffic Light Tree
properties.location:
5TG, Trafalgar Way
Blackwall, London
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Traffic Light Tree, located in the Canary Wharf area of London, is a unique and striking public art installation created by artist Pierre Vivant. Erected in 2010, the sculpture features a tree-like structure adorned with multiple traffic lights, which change colors in a choreographed sequence. This art piece serves not only as a visual spectacle but also as a commentary on the intersection of art and urban life. The installation attracts visitors and passersby, offering an intriguing blend of technology and aesthetics in a bustling urban setting.

properties.name: Blackwall Basin
properties.location:
Blackwall Basin
London
UK
properties.description: Blackwall Basin is a picturesque waterfront area located in East London, adjacent to the River Thames. Historically significant, it was once a thriving dockland area, playing a crucial role in maritime trade. Today, Blackwall Basin is known for its scenic riverside walks, modern residential developments, and views of the iconic Canary Wharf skyline. The area also features various recreational spaces, offering visitors opportunities for leisurely strolls and picnics by the water. Its blend of historical charm and modern architecture makes Blackwall Basin a unique destination for those exploring London.

properties.name: BrewDog
properties.location:
2 Churchill Pl
London E14 5RB
United Kingdom
properties.description: BrewDog Canary Wharf is a BrewDog bar situated in London's Eastern Financial District, offering a selection of craft beers from their Scottish brewery, small batch brews, and guest beers. The menu features burgers, loaded fries, hot wings, and brunch options. The venue includes a co-working space for those seeking an alternative to the office environment.

properties.name: The Ivy
properties.location:
50 Canada Square Park
London E14 5FW
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Ivy in the Park at Canada Square is a contemporary British restaurant located in Canary Wharf, London. It offers all-day dining with a menu that includes British classics, Asian-inspired dishes, and vegetarian and vegan options. The restaurant features two floors, a bar, and two outdoor terraces overlooking Canada Square Park. It is part of The Ivy Collection, a group of restaurants known for their sophisticated yet friendly dining experiences.

properties.name: Pergola on the Wharf
properties.location:
Crossrail Pl
London E14 5AR
United Kingdom
properties.description: Pergola on the Wharf is a nature-inspired eatery located in Canary Wharf, London. Situated within the roof gardens of Crossrail Place, it offers a botanical ambiance with walls adorned with real ferns, flowers, and vines. The venue features a lush green bar space and a picturesque terrace overlooking the north dock, providing panoramic views. The menu focuses on elegant, sustainably sourced meals crafted from fresh, natural, and seasonal ingredients. In the evenings, the venue comes alive with live DJ sets and drinks, creating a vibrant atmosphere. Regular events include Bottomless Brunch on Saturdays, Pergola Lates on Fridays, and Soulful Sundays, offering a variety of experiences for guests.

properties.name: Flip Out
properties.location:
Canary Wharf Shopping Centre
Cabot Square, London E14 4QS
UK
properties.description: Flip Out Canary Wharf is an indoor trampoline park situated in the bustling Canary Wharf Shopping Centre. This exciting venue features a variety of trampoline-based activities, including free jumping, dodgeball, and fitness classes. Suitable for all ages, it offers a fun and energetic environment for visitors looking to enjoy physical activity in a unique setting. With its extensive facilities, Flip Out is a popular destination for families, friends, and groups celebrating special occasions.

properties.name: Jubilee Park
properties.location:
Bank St
London E14 5JP
United Kingdom
properties.description: Jubilee Park is a public park located at Bank Street, London E14 5JP, United Kingdom. It is situated above Jubilee Place, a shopping mall, and Canary Wharf Jubilee Station, an underground railway station. The park, opened in 2002, was named in honour of the Golden Jubilee of Elizabeth II. Its central feature is a raised serpentine water channel with rough stone walls, designed to contrast with the surrounding buildings. In 2023, Jubilee Park won the Green Flag Award, recognising it as one of the United Kingdom's best parks.

properties.name: Eden Dock
properties.location:
Eden Dock
Heron Quays Rd, London E14 4HJ
United Kingdom
properties.description: Eden Dock is a picturesque location in London, nestled amidst the bustling Canary Wharf area. This waterfront space provides visitors with beautiful views of the River Thames and the surrounding skyline. Ideal for leisurely strolls, Eden Dock is adorned with green areas and pathways, inviting both locals and tourists to enjoy a peaceful retreat from the city's hustle. The area showcases a blend of modern architecture and natural beauty, making it a perfect spot for relaxation or casual gatherings.

properties.name: The Alchemist
properties.location:
Canary Wharf
London E14 5AJ
UK
properties.description: The Alchemist Canary Wharf is a contemporary bar and restaurant located in Reuters Plaza, London. Spanning two floors with two outdoor terraces, it offers a unique dining experience with riverside views. The venue is renowned for its molecular mixology, where bartenders craft cocktails with theatrical presentations. The menu features a diverse selection of dishes inspired by global cuisines, catering to various tastes throughout the day. Signature cocktails include The Lightbulb Moment, a gin-based drink served with dramatic plumes of smoke. The Alchemist also hosts live DJ sets on select evenings, adding to its vibrant atmosphere.

properties.name: Caravan
properties.location:
Reuters Plaza
London E14 5AJ
United Kingdom
properties.description: Caravan Canary Wharf is a contemporary restaurant and bar located in Reuters Plaza, Canary Wharf. The venue features a stripped-back, sun-drenched dining space with terrazzo, natural stone, and breeze block elements. It offers an all-day dining experience with a globally inspired menu, including dishes like sourdough pizza, grain bowls, and small plates. The restaurant also serves freshly roasted craft coffee and a selection of cocktails. With both indoor and outdoor seating, it caters to various occasions, from business breakfasts to intimate dinners and after-work drinks.

properties.name: Yummzy
properties.location:
18-19 Cabot Sq
London E14 4PZ
United Kingdom
properties.description: Yummzy is a bakery and café located at 18-19 Cabot Square, Canary Wharf, London E14 4PZ, United Kingdom. It specializes in gluten-free, vegan, and low-carb baked goods, offering a variety of desserts and savory items. The establishment is not part of a large chain restaurant.

properties.name: BOKAN 37
properties.location:
40 Marsh Wall
London E14 9TP
United Kingdom
properties.description: BOKAN 37 is a modern European restaurant situated on the 37th floor of Novotel London Canary Wharf, offering panoramic views of the London skyline. The menu features artisanal dishes crafted from a mix of local, ancient, and adopted British ingredients, inspired by rich European cultural cuisines. The interior design reflects the industrial heritage of Canary Wharf, with exposed brickwork, overhead metal pipes, and rustic timber accents, creating a chic and relaxed atmosphere. The restaurant is accessible via Canary Wharf Underground station, making it a convenient destination for both locals and visitors.

properties.name: Mudchute Park and Farm
properties.location:
Pier St
London E14 3HP
United Kingdom
properties.description: Mudchute Park and Farm is a sprawling green space in London, spanning 32 acres and offering a unique blend of agricultural experiences and leisure activities. Visitors can explore various farm animals, including sheep, goats, and alpacas, making it a delightful spot for families and children. The park features beautiful walking paths, picnic areas, and a café where guests can relax amidst nature. Educational programs and workshops about sustainable farming practices are also available, making it a community-focused destination. Its proximity to the Docklands adds to its appeal as an accessible retreat within the city.

properties.name: Docklands Sailing and Watersports Centre
properties.location:
235A Westferry Rd
London E14 3QS
United Kingdom
properties.description: Docklands Sailing and Watersports Centre is situated along the River Thames in London, providing a vibrant hub for sailing enthusiasts and those interested in watersports. The center offers a range of activities, including sailing, windsurfing, and kayaking, catering to individuals of all skill levels. It features a well-equipped facility, professional instructors, and organized courses for both adults and children. The picturesque location allows visitors to enjoy the stunning views of the riverside while engaging in recreational activities. The centre not only serves as a training ground but also promotes community engagement through various events and activities.

properties.name: The Ship
properties.location:
290 Westferry Rd
London E14 3AG
UK
properties.description: The Ship is a historic pub established in 1835, located at 290 Westferry Road, London E14 3AG, UK. It offers a wide selection of ice-cold beers, interesting ales, and seasonal cocktails. The pub serves homemade sourdough pizzas made with high-quality ingredients, with a seasonally changing menu. Entertainment options include three large-screen televisions for major sports events, a variety of board games, a pub quiz every Sunday at 8 pm, and a poker night every Monday. The Ship also provides bed and breakfast accommodations with three comfortable rooms, each offering a continental breakfast served in the room. Conveniently situated near excellent transport links, including DLR Mudchute Station and the Jubilee Line Canary Wharf, The Ship is an ideal spot to enjoy a refreshing drink or meal.

properties.name: Gaucho
properties.location:
29 Westferry Circus
London E14 8RR
United Kingdom
properties.description: Gaucho Canary Wharf is a riverside restaurant situated along the River Thames in London's Financial District. The venue offers panoramic views of the London skyline from its dining room and leafy terrace. The menu features a variety of Argentinian steaks, including signature cuts like Tira de Ancho (spiral-cut rib-eye) and Colita de Lomo (Aberdeen Angus steak). In addition to steaks, the restaurant offers seafood and vegetarian options. The interior boasts a sleek, modern design with dark woods, plush leather seating, and ambient lighting, creating a sophisticated atmosphere. The terrace is popular during the summer months, providing a scenic setting for al fresco dining. The restaurant also hosts events such as DJ-hosted brunches and offers private dining spaces for special occasions.

properties.name: Uber Boat by Thames Clippers
properties.location:
Canary Wharf Pier Docklands E14 8RR
UK
properties.description: Uber Boat by Thames Clippers at Canary Wharf Pier offers a convenient and scenic way to travel along the Thames River. This service is known for its modern vessels that allow passengers to enjoy views of iconic London landmarks from the water. With frequent sailings, it provides an efficient alternative to road or rail travel, connecting key areas of London. The service caters to both commuters and tourists, aiming to enhance the urban travel experience while promoting the use of waterways.

properties.name: Tower Bridge
properties.location:
Tower Bridge Rd
London SE1 2UP
United Kingdom
properties.description: Tower Bridge, completed in 1894, is a Grade I listed combined bascule and suspension bridge spanning the River Thames in London. Designed by architect Horace Jones and engineer John Wolfe Barry, it connects the boroughs of Tower Hamlets and Southwark. The bridge features two 213-foot towers connected by high-level walkways, offering panoramic views of the city. Visitors can experience the Glass Floors in the walkways, providing a unique perspective of London life below. The Victorian Engine Rooms house original steam engines and hydraulic machinery, showcasing the bridge's engineering heritage. Tower Bridge remains a vital crossing, used by over 40,000 people daily, and is a defining symbol of London's skyline.

properties.name: Tower Bridge Engine Rooms
properties.location:
Bridge Masters Residence
Tower Bridge Rd, London SE1 2UP
UK
properties.description: The Tower Bridge Engine Rooms is a fascinating historical exhibition located in London, showcasing the original Victorian engines that powered the bridge's lifting mechanism. Visitors can explore the restored engine rooms, where they can learn about the bridge's intricate engineering and its significance in London's transportation history. The exhibit features interactive displays and informative sections detailing the construction and operation of the bridge over the years, making it an engaging destination for those interested in engineering, history, and architecture.

properties.name: The Real Greek
properties.location:
s House, Duchess Walk, Bridgemaster
Tower Bridge, London SE1 2UP
United Kingdom
properties.description: Slick, modern restaurant with a menu of updated classic dishes, plus ouzo & Greek wines.

properties.name: The Circle
properties.location:
THE CIRCLE
Queen Elizabeth St, London SE1 2JE
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Circle is a Grade II listed residential building in London's Shad Thames area, designed by architect Piers Gough and completed in 1989. Its distinctive cobalt blue glazed brick facade comprises four quadrants, with a central courtyard featuring a bronze statue of 'Jacob,' a Dray Horse that historically pulled beer barrels from the nearby Anchor Brewhouse to the Tap Room. Located adjacent to the River Thames and east of Tower Bridge, The Circle offers easy access to local attractions and transport links.

properties.name: La Chingada Bermondsey
properties.location:
182 Jamaica Rd
London SE16 4RT
United Kingdom
properties.description: La Chingada Bermondsey offers an authentic Mexican dining experience in the heart of London. The restaurant's menu features traditional dishes such as tacos, quesadillas, and burritos, all crafted with fresh ingredients and bold flavors. The vibrant decor and lively atmosphere make it an ideal spot for both casual meals and special occasions. Located at 182 Jamaica Road, London SE16 4RT, La Chingada Bermondsey is part of a group that also includes locations in Surrey Quays and Euston, all dedicated to bringing the best of Mexican cuisine to London.

properties.name: King's Stairs Gardens
properties.location:
281 Jamaica Rd
London SE16 4RS
United Kingdom
properties.description: King's Stairs Gardens is a scenic public park located along the River Thames in London. It offers a tranquil retreat from the bustling city, featuring beautifully landscaped gardens, walking paths, and seating areas. Visitors can enjoy picturesque views of the river and surrounding areas. The park is ideal for outdoor activities such as picnicking, walking, or simply relaxing in nature. With its lush greenery and serene atmosphere, King's Stairs Gardens is a delightful spot for both locals and tourists seeking a peaceful escape.

properties.name: The Brunel
properties.location:
47 Swan Rd
London SE16 4JN
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Brunel, located in London, is known for its friendly atmosphere and welcoming staff. This neighborhood pub is dog-friendly and features an outdoor area equipped with a large TV. It is a popular spot with locals who enjoy watching sports, reading, or chatting over drinks. The pub offers a selection of beers and cocktails, with lines that are regularly cleaned. It has a garden with beach huts. The pub also hosts music and disco events on weekends and a pub quiz on Sundays.

properties.name: Russia Dock Woodland
properties.location:
Somerford Way
London SE16 6QW
United Kingdom
properties.description: Russia Dock Woodland is a tranquil nature reserve located in the heart of London. Once an industrial dock, it has been transformed into a lush green space featuring a diverse array of trees and plants. Visitors can enjoy scenic walking paths, a picturesque woodland area, and views of the river that add to the serene atmosphere. The area is popular with locals for its peaceful environment and is ideal for quiet reflection or leisurely strolls, making it a hidden gem amidst the urban landscape.

properties.name: The Pacific Tavern
properties.location:
100 Redriff Rd
London SE16 7LH
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Pacific Tavern, located at 100 Redriff Road in London, offers a unique dining experience inspired by the diverse cultures of the Pacific region. The menu features dishes such as whole BBQ fish, seabream crudo, and grilled chicken with mole rojo, all prepared over an open flame in an outdoor kitchen. The venue boasts a year-round beer garden, providing a vibrant space for guests to enjoy live music events and a selection of Pacific ales, lagers, and island-inspired cocktails. The interior combines reclaimed wood and a pub-centric bar, creating a warm and inviting atmosphere suitable for intimate gatherings and group dining.

properties.name: Cha-Fe
properties.location:
4 Mulberry Walk
London SE16 6BL
UK
properties.description: Cha-Fe is a café situated at 4 Mulberry Walk, London SE16 6BL, UK. It offers a selection of teas and coffees, complemented by pastries. The café has hosted events like Mid-Autumn Festival workshops and watercolour painting sessions. The surrounding area has a low crime rate, rated 3 out of 10.

properties.name: Phantom Peak
properties.location:
Surrey Quays Rd
London SE16 7PJ
United Kingdom
properties.description: Phantom Peak is an immersive adventure experience located in Surrey Quays, London. It features a unique blend of storytelling, interactive elements, and scenic environments, transporting visitors to a captivating world filled with exploration and mystery. The attraction combines elements of live-action role-play and theatrical performances, allowing guests to participate in various activities and uncover secrets within its richly designed setting. Ideal for those seeking a distinctive outing, Phantom Peak promises to engage visitors of all ages in a memorable way.

properties.name: Minecraft Experience: Villager Rescue
properties.location:
Surrey Quays Shopping Centre
Redriff Rd, London SE16 7LL
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Minecraft Experience: Villager Rescue is an immersive gaming attraction located within the Surrey Quays Shopping Centre in London. This interactive experience allows participants to step into the world of Minecraft, where they can engage in challenges and quests that incorporate elements from the popular game. Attendees work together to rescue villagers while exploring vibrant, pixelated landscapes. The attraction aims to provide a unique blend of entertainment and teamwork, making it a compelling choice for families and gamers alike.

properties.name: Express Fish Bar
properties.location:
160 Lower Rd
London SE16 2UG
United Kingdom
properties.description: Express Fish Bar is a family-run establishment located in London, renowned for its freshly prepared fish and chips. The menu features a variety of options, including traditional fish and chips, flame-grilled burgers, fried chicken, and more. The restaurant is committed to food safety, holding a 5 Star Food Hygiene Rating, and serves Halal meat to cater to a diverse clientele. Customers appreciate the generous portions and high-quality food, making it a popular choice among locals and visitors alike.

properties.name: La Chingada
properties.location:
12 Rotherhithe New Rd
London SE16 2AA
United Kingdom
properties.description: La Chingada is a vibrant Mexican eatery in London, known for its authentic tacos and colorful decor. The menu features classic fillings like carnitas, al pastor, suadero, and carne asada, complemented by a variety of salsas. Specialties include Baja prawn tacos and molett, a dish with refried beans and melted cheese on white bread. The restaurant imports Mexican soft drinks and offers vegetarian options, such as cactus tacos with cheese, mushrooms, onions, and peppers. La Chingada is committed to using fresh, local, and organic ingredients, providing a genuine taste of Mexico in London.

properties.name: Eat Vietnam Bar B Grill 1
properties.location:
234 Evelyn St
London SE8 5BZ
UK
properties.description: Eat Vietnam Bar B Grill 1 is a family-run Vietnamese restaurant in Deptford, London, offering authentic dishes like pho, banh mi, and grilled meats. The cozy atmosphere and friendly staff enhance the dining experience. The restaurant also donates 10% of its tips to charities in Vietnam, reflecting its commitment to community support.

properties.name: The Watergate
properties.location:
5
9 Watergate St, London SE8 3HR
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Watergate is known for its stylish and cozy atmosphere, complete with moody lighting, making it suitable for various occasions, including solo drinks, group gatherings, or romantic evenings. The spot offers a variety of sharing dishes and tasty cocktails. It's known for its pretty European-leaning dishes and grown-up cocktails. The location has received praise for its attentive, friendly, and professional staff. A popular item on their brunch menu is the spicy Bloody Mary.

properties.name: Arapina
properties.location:
8 Little Thames Walk
London SE8 3FB
UK
properties.description: Arapina Bakery is a vegan and vegetarian bakery in Greenwich, London, known for its Mediterranean-inspired treats. The bakery offers a variety of pastries, cakes, and savory items, all made from natural ingredients without additives or colors. Their menu includes vegan and gluten-free options, such as vegan pain au chocolat and pistachio crolls. The interior features a bright, plant-lined decor, creating a cozy atmosphere for customers. Arapina also provides a breakfast and brunch menu, with items like vegan pancakes and plant-based scrambled eggs. In addition to their Greenwich location, they have expanded to East Dulwich and participate in various South London markets.

properties.name: Cutty Sark
properties.location:
King William Walk
London SE10 9HT
United Kingdom
properties.description: Cutty Sark is a celebrated 19th-century tea clipper located in Greenwich, London. Once one of the fastest ships of its time, it is now a museum that showcases maritime history and the Golden Age of Sail. Visitors can explore the ship's deck and learn about its fascinating journeys around the world, particularly its role in the tea trade with China. The Cutty Sark is an iconic symbol of Britain's maritime heritage and offers stunning views of the Thames River, making it a must-visit landmark for history enthusiasts and travelers alike.

properties.name: National Maritime Museum
properties.location:
Romney Rd
London SE10 9NF
United Kingdom
properties.description: The National Maritime Museum is one of the largest maritime museums in the world, dedicated to exploring Britain's naval history and its impact on global trade and culture. Located in Greenwich, it houses a vast collection of artifacts, including ship models, paintings, and navigational instruments, offering insights into maritime exploration and the Royal Navy's storied past. The museum features engaging exhibitions that cater to all ages, making it a popular destination for tourists and history enthusiasts alike. Visitors can also enjoy the serene park surroundings and nearby attractions, such as the Royal Observatory and the Cutty Sark.

properties.name: The Gipsy Moth
properties.location:
60 Greenwich Church St
Greater, London SE10 9BL
United Kingdom
properties.description: The Gipsy Moth is a historic pub located at 60 Greenwich Church Street, London SE10 9BL, United Kingdom. Situated near the Cutty Sark, it offers a traditional British pub experience with a variety of beers, wines, and classic pub food. The pub features a spacious beer garden, making it a popular spot for both locals and tourists. It is dog-friendly and provides a comfortable atmosphere for patrons.

properties.name: Bianco43
properties.location:
43 Greenwich Church St
London SE10 9BL
United Kingdom
properties.description: Bianco43 Greenwich is an independent Italian restaurant located at 43 Greenwich Church Street, London SE10 9BL. The restaurant offers a cozy and inviting atmosphere, featuring a two-floor dining space adorned with artwork and decor that evoke the ambiance of a seaside Italian eatery. The menu showcases authentic Italian dishes, including wood-fired pizzas with dough fermented for 48 hours for enhanced flavor and digestibility, and a variety of pasta options. Ingredients are carefully sourced, with some imported directly from Italy to ensure authenticity. The restaurant is dog-friendly, welcoming well-behaved pets. It is conveniently situated near the Cutty Sark DLR station and Greenwich Market, making it easily accessible for both locals and visitors.

properties.name: Paul Rhodes
properties.location:
37 King William Walk
London SE10 9HU
United Kingdom
properties.description: Paul Rhodes Bakery is an independent establishment in Greenwich, London, renowned for its handcrafted breads, pastries, and cakes. The bakery also offers a selection of sandwiches and coffee, catering to both breakfast and lunch options. Operating hours are Monday to Friday from 7:00 AM to 6:00 PM, and weekends from 7:30 AM to 6:00 PM.

properties.name: Goddards
properties.location:
22 King William Walk
London SE10 9HU
United Kingdom
properties.description: Goddards at Greenwich, established in 1890, is a family-run restaurant renowned for its traditional British fare, especially pie and mash. Located at 22 King William Walk in Greenwich, London, the establishment offers a variety of handmade pies, including classic minced beef, as well as modern variations like lamb and rosemary or steak and ale. Each pie is served with mashed potatoes and a choice of liquor or gravy. The menu also features jellied eels, a classic London delicacy. The restaurant can accommodate up to 100 guests across its ground and first floors, providing a comfortable setting to enjoy a hearty meal.

properties.name: Sticks'n'Sushi
properties.location:
1 Nelson Rd.
London SE10 9JB
UK
properties.description: Sticks'n'Sushi Greenwich is a Japanese restaurant located in the heart of Greenwich, London. The restaurant offers a menu that combines traditional sushi and yakitori sticks, featuring a variety of meat and vegetable skewers. The interior design reflects a Nordic minimalist aesthetic, creating a warm and modern atmosphere. The restaurant is situated near the Cutty Sark, a historic clipper ship, and is surrounded by Greenwich's charming streets and independent shops.

properties.name: Chapel of St Peter and St Paul
properties.location:
College Row
London SE10 9LW
UK
properties.description: The Chapel of St Peter and St Paul is a historic ecclesiastical building located on College Row in London. Built in the 19th century, this chapel serves as a significant site within the University of Greenwich, offering a striking example of Gothic architecture. The interior is adorned with beautiful stained glass windows and intricate woodwork, creating an atmosphere of serenity and reflection. As a place of worship and a venue for various ceremonies, it also hosts community events, welcoming visitors and locals alike to experience its tranquil setting.

properties.name: Queen's House
properties.location:
Romney Rd
London SE10 9NF
United Kingdom
properties.description: Queen's House is a stunning 17th-century building designed by Inigo Jones, recognized for its classical architecture and significance in British history. Located in Greenwich, it serves as a museum showcasing a diverse range of artworks, including paintings and decorative arts. The house is famous for its grand interiors, which include the breathtaking Tulip Stairs and an impressive collection of maritime paintings. As part of the Royal Museums Greenwich, Queen's House offers visitors a glimpse into the past, surrounded by beautiful gardens and proximity to other historic sites, making it a worthwhile stop for tourists.

properties.name: Sefa
properties.location:
129-131 Trafalgar Rd
London SE10 9TX
United Kingdom
properties.description: Sefa Restaurant is a Turkish and Mediterranean eatery situated in Greenwich, London. The restaurant offers a diverse menu featuring traditional dishes such as kebabs, mezes, and grilled meats, all prepared using fresh, seasonal ingredients. The dining area provides a warm and relaxed atmosphere, complemented by contemporary decor. Sefa Restaurant is known for its commitment to quality, with all vegetables and meats personally selected to ensure the highest standards. The establishment also offers a variety of beverages, including Turkish wines, to accompany the meals. The restaurant has received positive reviews for its generous portions and friendly service, making it a popular choice among both locals and visitors.

properties.name: Mountain View
properties.location:
160 Trafalgar Rd
London SE10 9TZ
UK
properties.description: Mountain View is a family-owned restaurant in Greenwich, London, offering authentic Nepalese and Indian cuisine. The menu features traditional dishes such as Chicken Tikka Masala, Gorkhali Lamb, and MO:MO dumplings, with options for vegan, gluten-free, and dairy-free diets. The restaurant provides dine-in, takeaway, and delivery services, and also offers a function hall for private events accommodating up to 40 guests. The ambiance is warm and inviting, with friendly and attentive service. The restaurant has received positive reviews for its delicious food and welcoming atmosphere.

properties.name: Tapas Hut Negril
properties.location:
Christchurch Way
London SE10 9EQ
United Kingdom
properties.description: Tapas Hut Negril is a Caribbean food kiosk located in Greenwich, London, serving Jamaican dishes such as jerk chicken, goat curry, ackee & salt fish, and flaky roti. The chef, Gino, is known for his enthusiasm and passion for cooking, even growing some of the herbs and spices himself. The establishment has received positive reviews for its flavorful food and friendly service.

properties.name: Woolwich Town Hall
properties.location:
Wellington St
London SE18 6HQ
UK
properties.description: Woolwich Town Hall, an impressive local government building, is known for its stunning architectural design and historical significance. Completed in the early 20th century, it showcases a mix of neoclassical and Edwardian Baroque styles. The building features a prominent clock tower and beautifully decorated interiors, including grand staircases and council chambers. It serves as a venue for various civic events, weddings, and community activities, making it an important part of the Woolwich community. Visitors can explore its exterior and appreciate the surrounding green spaces.

properties.name: St George's Garrison Church
properties.location:
St George's Garrison Church
5 Mill Ln, London SE18 6BW
United Kingdom
properties.description: St George's Garrison Church is a historic church located in Woolwich, London. Originally built in the early 19th century, this church features striking Gothic architecture and served as a place of worship for the local military garrison. Its interior is notable for beautiful stained glass windows and a unique layout that reflects its military heritage. The church is significant not only as a religious site but also as a piece of local history, witnessing numerous events over the years. It is surrounded by a picturesque churchyard, inviting visitors to explore its serene atmosphere.

properties.name: Charlton House & Gardens
properties.location:
Charlton Rd
London SE7 8RE
United Kingdom
properties.description: Charlton House & Gardens is a remarkable Jacobean manor house located in the Royal Borough of Greenwich. Built in the early 17th century, it showcases beautiful architectural features and is surrounded by stunning gardens. The property served as a royal residence and is steeped in history, offering insights into the past. The gardens include a variety of flora and provide a peaceful retreat for visitors. The house is often used for community events and exhibitions, allowing guests to explore both its historical significance and its picturesque surroundings.
